titles: The slighted maid. Or, The pining lover. With sighs and moans she doth intreat her dear, whilst he seems to be deaf and will not hear; at length his frozen heart begins to melt, being moved with the passion she had felt. To the tune of, I prithee love turn to me.
notes: Date of publication taken from Wing (2nd ed.)
Right half sheet contains: The second part, to the same tune.
Reproduction of original in: University of Glasgow. Library.
